statement: Find the smallest natural number \(n\) whose decimal representation ends in 6, and such that moving this 6 to the front produces a number four times as large as \(n\).
Determine all real numbers \(x\) satisfying \(\sqrt{3 - x} - \sqrt{x + 1} > 1/2\).

Points \(X\) and \(Y\) start at \(A\) and \(B'\) respectively and move at equal constant speeds: \(X\) along perimeter \(ABCDA\) of square \(ABCD\), \(Y\) along perimeter \(B'C'CB\) of square \(B'C'CB\) of cube \(ABCDA'B'C'D'\). Find and draw the locus of the midpoints of segments \(XY\).
On circle \(K\) three distinct points \(A, B, C\) are given. Construct (with straightedge and compass) a fourth point \(D\) on \(K\) such that quadrilateral \(ABCD\) admits an inscribed circle.
For an isosceles triangle with circumradius \(r\) and inradius \(\rho\), prove that the distance \(d\) between their centers is \(d = \sqrt{r(r - 2\rho)}\).

Tetrahedron \(SABC\) admits five spheres each tangent to all six edges (or their extensions). (a) Prove \(SABC\) is regular. (b) Conversely, show every regular tetrahedron possesses five such spheres.
